author: Anonymous Scale
title: product of empty list
question:
I just wanted some clarification of what the multiplicative identity was
why is the expected result of an empty product 1?
student_answer:
The expected result of the base case depends on what the function is doing. It is basically something that will not change the result when the function runs through a non-empty list.

In this case it is
1
because multiplying a number by
1
does nothing.

You may expect it to be
0
because that is the default "null" value for Number/Natural/Integer but it wouldn't work for this specific function because multiplying a number by
0
overrules all the other numbers.
